comment.body:
Try opening the link in a new tab.

@antilibrary: This is a Firefox bug.  Make sure you change the `target` attribute to `_top`
`print '5LiN6...CB5p'.decode('base64').decode('utf-8')`

@Rythyrix: use markdown syntax for code blocks: ````your code here`
```

@Rythyrix: Firefox cannot show you a download dialog in a sandboxed iframe (Firefox bug), so the only way to download the file is to escape the iframe by changing `location.href` to a `blob:` URL, therefore generating a random file name.
Alex is back.
@Facepalm: @<username>:
Zee loo neto
The new Firefox handles all emoji icons for you.
@Th3B3st: The whole Tor Network is a big super node, a big TURN server, so ZeroNet uses onion services to communicate with computers on Tor.
No peers found. @Rofl: keep your ZeroNet and Tor running.
If you are running Tor Always Mode, your another computer needs to be an active peer (has port opened), or also using Tor.

ZeroNet can be really anonymous if you use it correctly. You can connect to ZeroNet through a SOCKS5 proxy, including Tor. You can use ZeroNet in Tor Browser. You can even use virtual machines to browse ZeroNet.
What's your bitcoin address?
Yeah, Tor Always mode never works for me. Perhaps I am seeding too many sites.
Select user

Stop ZeroNet and put your backup user.json file in the right place. Then it should show up once you restart ZeroNet. If you still can't see your account, open the side bar and click on "change identity address." A dialog will show up and let you choose between all of your certs.
@Durand: Nvidia-prime make my computer screen blank, and it won't boot. :(
@Durand: Yeah, it seems to be using NVIDIA all the time, leaving the Intel Graphics card untouched.

noti0news@zeroid.bit now posts things that at least make sense, but they are crawled from news websites and posted every few minutes. Here is how I banned him: `"noti0news@zeroid.bit": {"max_size": 1000},`
@Jjg: I did not switch it on, on both computers. There is a problem of synchronization, and signing an de-synced site can cause [loss of data](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/771).
I wrote a crawler program and mirrored a [VICE Motherboard](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1uEc35aRpkDgVmJ35jcMEHm4D2JCcEejp) page.
ZeroMux Video player works very well, because it is specifically designed for ZeroNet. :)

@Nekololi: I don't think so. Before PeerDb plugin, each bootstrap took me around 10 minutes.
Here is a complementary solution: `./zeronet.py --tor disable --disable_udp --proxy 127.0.0.1:9150`

Update ZeroTV site and hit Ctrl-F5

@Rythyrix: Have you read about [this bug](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/843) and [this commit](https://github.com/MuxZeroNet/ZeroMux/commit/b694e018b4c4996f868eaf690c49c9ff90969f0d#diff-532cf85ec3b656c424293aa6eeeadf9fR106)? There are some minor problems with FilePack plugin.

@Rythyrix: When you upload, you will see a textbox for renaming the file. Simply add an underscore. The folder name for the chunks will be changed accrodingly. You can change the file name back on the file list page.
